description: "Reactions let you respond to dots or comments using quick, expressive emoji responses. Instead of writing a full comment, you can react instantly with an emoji to show agreement, acknowledgment, appreciation, or urgency.This option helps teams communicate faster while keeping threads clean and easy to follow."

## üìù How to use Reactions

üßæ Navigate to the dot or thread where you want to react to a comment or message.

üòÄ Move your cursor over the comment or message you want to react to.

üñ±Ô∏è A small emoji reaction button will appear ‚Äî click it to open the reaction menu.

üéâ Choose from the reaction list (e.g., üëç, üòÄ, ‚ùó, ‚ù§Ô∏è). Your reaction will appear instantly under the comment.

üîÑ Click the same emoji again to remove it, or select another one to update your reaction.

üëÄ Hover over any reaction to see all users who reacted with that emoji.

::div{class="flex w-full justify-center max-w-6xl mx-auto h-120 py-4"}
:video{src="/reactions.mp4" class="rounded-md object-cover w-full h-full" controls autoplay muted loop}
::

### üí° Tips

* Use üëç to quickly acknowledge a message without adding noise to the thread.

* Use ‚ù§Ô∏è to show appreciation or support.

* Use ‚ùó for messages requiring urgent attention.

* Reactions help reduce clutter ‚Äî perfect for fast-moving teams or long threads.

* They‚Äôre great for confirming you‚Äôve seen an update without needing a full comment.
